DOC.HEAD: London Shares End Higher
Eds: UPDATES with close
DOC.TEXT: London share prices rose in abbreviated trading Friday, propelled by hearty yearend demand. Sentiment was helped by news that Britain's merchandise trade deficit narrowed to a better-than-expected 1.52 billion pounds, $2.4 billion, in November from 1.83 billion pounds, $2.9 billion, the previous month. The government's report raised hopes that interest rates won't be pushed higher. Higher opening prices in New York also boosted London trading. The Financial Times-Stock Exchange 100-share index was up 23.9 points, or 1 percent, at 2,422.7 points, just below its peak of 2,422.8 points. At its lowest, the index opened at 2,399.1. Trading closed at 3:30 p.m. (1530 GMT), 90 minutes hours earlier than normal, ahead of the four-day New Year's weekend. Volume amounted to 333.1 million shares, compared with 327.8 million shares which had changed hands by 3 p.m. Thursday.
